title: Steeley
author: Steeley
created_time: September 27, 2022, 05:26:16 PMLast edit: September 27, 2022, 09:17:00 PM by Steeley
content: Sweeteye's sweet auction of a very beautiful .1 Silver Lealana buyer funded with Black letters reminded me of an ongoing question about the rarity of these coins. The Encyclopedia lists the following numbers: LEALANALTC 1 with BF/Blk - pop of 40LTC 5 with BF/Blk - pop of 10 LTC 10 with BF/Blk - pop of 10 BTC .1 BRASS with BF/Blk - pop of 100BTC .1 SILVER with BF/Blk - pop of 10BTC .25 SILVER with BF/Blk - pop of 10BTC .5 SILVER w BF/Blk - pop 10BTC 1 SILVER 'Gold B; w BF/Blk - pop 10Honorable mentions: BTC .25 & .5 with Gold Holograms (25 & 10) and with Gold Hologram and BF/Blk (<3 of each)Every time these numbers come up they are disputed (which I am not arguing for or against). I am curious to know what we actually know. Any insight can help get closer to the real target numbers. Huge thanks Steeley

comments.author: YodasRedRocket
comments.body: I have a 2013 1st series 1 LTC Buyer Funded w/ Black First Bits... supposedly only 40 known out of 10,000 minted.

comments.author: Steeley
comments.body: Thanks Yoda. Forgot to include that one. 'Yes 40 reported in the encyclopedia. Is there any information contrary to this out there?

comments.author: YodasRedRocket
comments.body: Quote from: Steeley on September 27, 2022, 08:47:25 PMThanks Yoda. Forgot to include that one. 'Yes 40 reported in the encyclopedia. Is there any information contrary to this out there? I am a total noob when it comes to Lealana... I'm following to see what info comes up!

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: We know there are more than 10... 0.25 bf black.. pictures were produced that showed at least 15.. i own a bf black litecoin. And one bf funded black gold holo 0.25..  regardless of actually counts these are rare in numbers compared to standard lealana green label

comments.author: Hox
comments.body: QuoteBTC .1 SILVER with BF/Blk - pop of 10I had a full roll of 20 of these so there are at least that many of the 0.1 silver.

comments.author: Agrawas
comments.body: Quote from: Hox on September 27, 2022, 11:04:11 PMQuoteBTC .1 SILVER with BF/Blk - pop of 10I had a full roll of 20 of these so there are at least that many of the 0.1 silver.I have personally sold more than 20 of these in past 4-5 yr and know someone who has a roll of these too..

comments.author: sweeteye
comments.created_time: September 28, 2022, 10:11:52 AMLast edit: September 28, 2022, 11:23:06 AM by sweeteye
comments.body: [edit] It sounds like a more accurate description is that 5-10% of total issuance of 2013 .10 SIILVER coins is BF/Blk.

comments.author: Steeley
comments.body: Really appreciate the input. Knowing there were 2 rolls, etc. means that Sweeteye's comment is probably the best guess: there are likely 100 or so .1 BTC Silver BF/Blk in existence.

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: Eclipse has 15 bf black 0.1s for sale on ebay right now

comments.body: Quote from: Hox on September 27, 2022, 11:04:11 PMQuoteBTC .1 SILVER with BF/Blk - pop of 10I had a full roll of 20 of these so there are at least that many of the 0.1 silver.Didn't we get these numbers from smoothie. I swore there posts were something like 'i think there was X many"

comments.body: Quote from: FFrankie on October 02, 2022, 03:35:24 PMDidn't we get these numbers from smoothie. I swore there posts were something like 'i think there was X many" Anyone here with some python skillz that could scrape all of his past posts and check?

comments.body: Quote from: owlcatz on October 02, 2022, 03:39:36 PMQuote from: FFrankie on October 02, 2022, 03:35:24 PMDidn't we get these numbers from smoothie. I swore there posts were something like 'i think there was X many" Anyone here with some python skillz that could scrape all of his past posts and check?  Google gave me this linkhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1238485.msg12909181#msg12909181

comments.author: Steeley
comments.body: Quote from: FFrankie on October 03, 2022, 05:12:02 AMQuote from: owlcatz on October 02, 2022, 03:39:36 PMQuote from: FFrankie on October 02, 2022, 03:35:24 PMDidn't we get these numbers from smoothie. I swore there posts were something like 'i think there was X many" Anyone here with some python skillz that could scrape all of his past posts and check?  Google gave me this linkhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=1238485.msg12909181#msg12909181Thanks Frankie. This helps and kind of muddies the water at the same time. I’m not sure there will be a definitive number of Buyer Funded Black accounted for. It also gets muddier with the .5 and .25 btc silvers. For example, Smoothie says there are 1000 .25 BTC silvers, 200 with gold holos. how many are black ltrs, bf/blk and  of the 200 gold holos how many  are green, blk and  BF/Black? 10-20 bf/blk probably using Sweeteye’s suggestion of 5-10%.  Then… An even bigger rarity is a BF/Blk version of these two coins with a gold hologram instead of the standard silver hologram, but even Smoothie’s accounting does not specify these. Anyway, this is all very nerdy but I hope we celebrate these as rarities. It’s good for the hobbyist.
